import { useState } from 'react' import { ReactSortable } from 'react-sortablejs' import img1 from '@Assets/images/portrait/small/avatar-s-12.jpg' import img2 from '@Assets/images/portrait/small/avatar-s-1.jpg' import img3 from '@Assets/images/portrait/small/avatar-s-2.jpg' import img4 from '@Assets/images/portrait/small/avatar-s-3.jpg' import img5 from '@Assets/images/portrait/small/avatar-s-4.jpg' import { Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardBody, CardText, ListGroupItem, Media } from 'reactstrap' const listItems = [ { id: '1', img: img1, name: 'Mary S. Navarre', content: 'Chupa chups tiramisu apple pie biscuit sweet roll bonbon macaroon toffee icing.' }, { id: '2', img: img2, name: 'Samuel M. Ellis', content: 'Toffee powder marzipan tiramisu. Cake cake dessert danish.' }, { id: '3', img: img3, name: 'Sandra C. Toney', content: 'Sugar plum fruitcake gummies marzipan liquorice tiramisu. Pastry liquorice chupa chupsake.' }, { id: '4', img: img4, name: 'Cleveland C. Goins', content: 'Toffee powder marzipan tiramisu. Cake cake dessert danish.' }, { id: '5', img: img5, name: 'Linda M. English', content: 'Chupa chups tiramisu apple pie biscuit sweet roll bonbon macaroon toffee icing.' } ] const DndListGroup = () => { const [listArr, setListArr] = useState(listItems) return ( Basic List Group Sortable The most basic list group is simply an unordered list with list items, and the proper classes. {listArr.map(item => { return (
{item.name}
{item.content} ) })} ) } export default DndListGroup
